news.title: Limusaurus: Beaked, Bird-Like Dinosaur Species Had Teeth as Juveniles, Lost Them as They Grew | Paleontology | Sci-News.com
news.summary: An international team of paleontologists has discovered that Limusaurus inextricabilis, a species of Jurassic dinosaur, lost its teeth in adolescence and did not grow another set as adults.

wikipedia.title: Limusaurus
wikipedia.summary: Limusaurus (meaning "mud lizard") is a genus of beaked herbivorous theropod dinosaur from the Jurassic (Oxfordian stage) Upper Shishugou Formation in the Junggar Basin of western China.
